name: places/ChIJUcAEQ5lZwokRWQvj6pctBhE
adrFormatAddress: 93 4th Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: Zesty manager guy won’t take packages off you even after waiting in line. Points you to the self check out kiosk and makes you do it yourself after waiting in line. Also tells his staff to do the same and one of them told me she didn’t have time to take the package off my hands after i waited in like to be helped. Terrible customer service from the Zesty manager and his employee. Would highly recommend going to any other post office besides this one till they get new management or employees.

originalText.text: Brenda, with the short red hair, called me "lazy" today to her coworker while I was standing right there for using a label maker to label my mail. When I called her out for it, she asked me if I "missed my therapy appointment today." Got her supervisor who said there were "two sides to every story" as if it is ever justified to talk that way to a customer (or anyone) who did nothing to you. Complained he was in the middle of a meeting as if it is my fault Brenda insulted me and projected her need for therapy. Seriously wild a government employee can just randomly insult people like that. Can't imagine how sad Brenda's personal life must be to act that way

originalText.text: I will never understand why it is so difficult for this post office to perform even their basic duties or take a modicum of pride in their jobs. We have informed delivery which shows us the mail we should be receiving every day. I'm writing this on a Thursday and we haven't received our mail since last Saturday. Today we received a package - still no mail - and it was left outside of the locked door and they didn't even ring our apartment. I'd love to know where I can get a job where I don't have to perform it each day and, when I do, can do the least amount of work possible. Oh, the post office!

originalText.text:
This is my Post office!  I love visiting.  Paula is so AWESOME, understanding and a huge breathe of fresh air.  She keeps her composure no matter how stressing we customers are.

Paula is a great example of team work, patience and joy wrapped all one.  Can someone please give this woman a raise?

text.text:

Paula is a great example of team work, patience and joy wrapped all one.  Can someone please give this woman a raise?

originalText.text: Paula is my go to for everything USPS! She recognizes me each time I enter and basically holds my hand making my frequent shipping seamless. All the clerks at this station are wonderful in their customer service roles but Paula is the one manning the floor. Thank you USPS for this gem and having the coolest post office around! Much appreciated!
